sub_title: Researcher in Public Policy and Digitalisation Topics | Higher Education Enthusiast | European Affairs
summary:
Recent MA graduate in European Society, Politics and Culture in a Global Context (with distinction), who has a passion for the field of higher education and various other issues such as globalisation, public policy, culture, and society.

Contact: viddynaufal@hotmail.com

treasury_media.title: Padjadjaran Model United Nations 2014: Paving Road to Bridge Generations
treasury_media.description: Unpad.ac.id, 7/05/2014] Badan Pengurus Harian Himpunan Mahasiswa program studi Hubungan Internasional Fakultas Ilmu Sosial dan Ilmu Politik Universitas Padjadjaran (BPH Hima HI FISIP Unpad) mengadakan Padjadjaran Model United Nations, yaitu simulasi konferensi PBB tingkat universitas yang diikuti oleh mahasiswa dari 20 perguruan tinggi se-Indonesia pada 1-3 Mei 2014 lalu di...

treasury_media.title: Publication: "Ensuring the Protection of Items of Scientific Educational or Cultural Significance during Times of Significance Upheaval"
treasury_media.description: Selected to publish a briefing paper as conference substance material to be discussed in United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) committee in the 20th Session of Asia-Pacific Model United Nations Conference (AMUNC) 2014, held at Queensland University of Technology (QUT), in Brisbane, Queensland, Australia.

treasury_media.title: Honorable Mention Indonesia Model United Nations 2011
treasury_media.description: Awarded for outstanding performance as a delegate representing United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland in United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO), deliberating “Accessible Education for All,” competed 30 students from all over Indonesia.

treasury_media.title: Honorable Mention National Model United Nations New York 2013
treasury_media.description: BANDUNG, KOMPAS.com - Universitas Padjadjaran (Unpad) Bandung mengirimkan tujuh mahasiswa perwakilannya untuk menghadiri National Model United Nations (NMUN) atau simulasi sidang PBB di New York, Amerika Setikat, 17-21 Maret 2013. "Kegiatan NMUN merupakan semacam simulasi sidang PBB yang terdiri dari beberapa komite-komite.

treasury_media.title: Director of United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO)
treasury_media.description:
Invited as international director that is responsible in managing the committee sessions, composing, and developing briefing paper, and chairing one of the biggest regional United Nations simulation in Asia-Pacific, from June 30th-July 4th, 2014, at Queensland University of Technology (QUT), in Brisbane, Queensland, Australia.

http://www.unsauq.org/muns/amunc/

awards.title: Erasmus+ Scholarship
awards.description: - Being awarded a full scholarship to pursue a Master's degree in Euroculture: Society, Politics, and Culture in a Global Context at three European universities: Université de Strasbourg, France; Uniwersytet Jagielloński w Krakowie, Poland; and Rijksuniversiteit Groningen, the Netherlands, within two years of study.

awards.title: Promoted to Present a Scientific Presentation “Indonesian People Addiction to Spicy Food: A Social and Historical Perspective” in ASEAN-Japan Exchange Program from Kwansei Gakuin University, Japan
awards.description: Alongside with 4 other outstanding students from International Relations Study Program Universitas Padjadjaran, promoted by Prof. Yanyan M. Yani to present the presentation in front of Professor Washio Tomoharu and Kwansei Gakuin University Students Delegation for ASEAN-Japan Exchange Program.

awards.title: Received in Exclusive Lunch and Interview by His Excellency Prince Nikolaus of Liechtenstein, Ambassador of Liechtenstein in Belgium

projects.title: Euro Mentorship
projects.description:
- Initiated a 2 month long mentorship project that connected two Erasmus Mundus program students of Euroculture and European Politics & Society and alumni that mostly working in the European affairs sector in a mentorship and career coaching project.
- Designed a one day course of CV composing for more than 20 participants coming from both Erasmus Mundus programs.

projects.title: Anti Human Trafficking Act
projects.description:
Role: Program Director

A Social project that includes socialization regarding human trafficiking with the target susceptible rural area in West Java. The project was conducted in creative programs such as personal approach in theatrical explanation regarding the practice of human trafficking and future orientation for middle and high school students.The project was concluded in a month, with more than 100 attendees.

projects.title: Padjadjaran Model United Nations
projects.description: Proliferating a complete MUN experience to varsity students in Bandung and Indonesia through a three-day conference which packed committee sessions and social events together. Also pioneering the gradual adaptation of a more accurate procedures of the United Nations in national MUN conferences.

projects.title: National Seminar on Indonesia Maritime Potentials
projects.description:
Role: Liaison Services

Promoting the reemergence of Indonesia maritime potentials in regards to the forthcoming ASEAN Community. Keynote speech delivered by the Indonesian Navy Chief of Staff Laksmana TNI Marsetio with the following renowned speakers:

1. Professor Susanto Zuhdi (Universitas Indonesia; Historian)
2. Professor Yanyan Mochamad Yani (Universitas Padjadjaran; International Relations Expert)
3. Professor Dietrich Bengen (Institute Pertanian Bogor; Indonesia Maritime Institute)
4. I Gusti Wesaka Puja (Directorate General for ASEAN Cooperation, Ministry of Foreign Affairs)
5. Laksma Maritim TNI Eko Hadi Susilo (Head of Center of Information, Cooperation, and Legal Affairs, Indonesia Coordinating Board of Marine Security)
6. Suryo A. B., DEA (Maritime Geopolitics Expert; Editor in Chief of Jurnal Maritim)

profile_positions.description: Researching how hopes and fears about digitalisation shape opinions on social and labour policies in middle income countries (Indonesia, Mexico, and South Africa).
profile_positions.title: Doctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description:
- Initiated a budget-friendly travel agency that targets Indonesian youngsters with Thailand and Japan as focus destinations.
- Offering a friendly payment method (installments) to the customers.
- Offering the services for travel & tourist visa arrangement and airplane ticket sales.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder & Co-CEO

profile_positions.description: Reviewing the management and activities of CIM Horyzonty, a non-profit organisation based in Poznań, Poland. The institutions bring along European Solidarity Corps (volunteers from Europe and all around the world) to work on intercultural topics and promote diversity to Polish school students and elderly.
profile_positions.title: Consultant Internship

profile_positions.description: Being part of the project Measuring and Comparing Achievements of Learning Outcomes in Higher Education in Asia (CALOHEA), composing a report on opportunities, challenges and recommendation for internationalisation of higher education in Southeast Asia and the EU SHARE project phase 2.
profile_positions.title: Research Intern for International Tuning Academy

profile_positions.location: Embassy of the Kingdom of The Netherlands, Jalan HR Rasuna Said, Kav. S-3, Jakarta
profile_positions.description:
·       Supporting Southeast Asian prospective students, 3-5 students per day and up to 50 requests per day in (September – January) in application preparation and scholarship application for Dutch Universities. 
·       Planning and implementing large-scale annual events of the office such as Holland Education Fair (that involved 25 Dutch Higher Education Institutions and 2500+ attendees annually), Pre-Departure Briefing (involved 500 students annually), and other smaller scale events. In charge of the administrative matters such as finances and reporting of the events. 
·       Initiating transformation of onsite events into online promotional and student support activities in the first wave of the pandemic. The activities consisted of guest lectures from Dutch university professors, sharing sessions with current students, and counseling sessions. The activities took place 2-3 times per week.
.	Supporting engagement activities of 24,000 NL alumni in Indonesia in various activities such as alumni dinner (with up to 300 alumni in Jakarta and around 30-50 alumni in every city outside Jakarta), alumni charity (10-20 alumni per city), networking events/business meeting (10-20 alumni per city), and Southeast Asia career fair (1,420 Southeast Asian alumni).
.	Supporting social media campaign of education promotion team and stakeholders’ dedicated events (the MBA tour and Dutch universities promotional campaign). The activities include creating promotional content, designing targeted ads and communication strategies, managing social media (Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, and Twitter), sending out promotional content through a mailing list, and composing analytical reports.
.       Managing administrative and operational matters of promotional activities including arranging roadshow schedules, finances, and travel; managing social media and communication; developing promotional content and supporting Dutch universities tailor-made activities in Indonesia and Southeast Asia.
profile_positions.title: Student Counselor

volunteer_experiences.description:
- Providing high-quality information on studying and pursuing a professional career abroad for Indonesian aspirants.
- Designing content, material, and courses for training and information events of Indonesia Mengglobal.
- In charge with liaising with current and potential partners of the organisation.
- Initiated more inclusive events tailor-made for the underrepresented communities in the Eastern part of Indonesia with more than 1000 applicants of which 90% are coming from the target area (outside Java & Bali).
- Initiated a more inclusive approach to the existing event of Ph.D. Bootcamp, by opening a special affirmation stream for those coming from outside Java, Bali.

- Initiated a volunteer-based community that gathers bi-weekly to support study abroad and scholarship aspirants in Jakarta, Indonesia
- Starting with only 6 members, the community grew into having more than 500 members (based on database), and more than 50 succesful member that pursued their study abroad

volunteer_experiences.role: Event Division Volunteer at Asian African Literacy Week
volunteer_experiences.description: Managing one of the series of event, the storytelling for elementary students by Young African Ambassadors in Asia, in collaboration with Public Educators Club.
